doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 5 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 1/26/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 5 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 1/26/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Evan Wolfson2. Discussion of gays voting for anti-gay political leadersCOMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey3. Congress looks into banning cigarette ads, and the regulation of private decisions by government4. Re-opening gay bathhouses and the ethics of thisCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine5. Andy Humm on Catholic conservatives intervening in the youth sex education6. News Briefs, In Seattle, Oregon's human rights commission prohibits discrimination against persons with AIDS7. Connecticut's first housing complex exclusively for people with AIDS raises $30,0008. AZT drug available only in limited supply when it becomes available9. Chinese government requires foreign students to take HTLVIII virus test10. Austin city council passes anti-discrimination bill11. South Korea requires mandatory AIDS testing for all employees of service industries12. Sports Report13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazineCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcements3. Interview with Michael Petrelis a resident of the Bailey House for people with AIDSCOMMERCIAL: The World of Video4. Show Bits, George Trahanis reviews Broadway play, "Stepping Out," with clipsCOMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs5. Conclusion of Michael Weyand's interview of Walter Williams, author of "The Spirit in the Flesh"6. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 5 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 1/26/1987]: January 1987
